title: Hong Kong Activist Joshua Wong Jailed for More Than a Year Over 2019 Protest
sub_head: Former student leader among three imprisoned as authorities crack down harder on political opponents
body:
HONG KONG—Joshua Wong, who emerged from a 79-day street occupation in 2014 as the leading face of a new generation of young activists who infuriated China’s leaders, was jailed for more than a year on Wednesday for inciting and organizing protesters who besieged Hong Kong police headquarters last year.
Magistrate Wong Sze-lai sentenced Mr. Wong and two other activists, who had all pleaded guilty to charges stemming from the rally that ramped up tensions between protesters and police early in last year’s mass uprising. Mr....
